key.name: default-gamma
key.summary: The default gamma to use for monitors with no previous value set
key.description: Gamma is adjusted to affect the color of the attached monitor. Traditionally Linux has used a gamma value of 1.0, but this makes monitors look washed out compared Windows XP or OS X. Apple traditionally used a value of 1.8 for a long time, but now use the same value as Microsoft. Microsoft has always used a value of 2.2.

key.name: show-notifications
key.description: If set to TRUE then notifications and messages will be used.

key.name: global-display-correction
key.summary: Whether the display should be globally corrected or left to applications
key.description: If set to TRUE then the video LUT is set with the display profile

key.name: set-icc-profile-atom
key.description: If set to TRUE then the __ICC_PROFILE hint will be set, which applications use to convert true color to screen color.

key.name: rendering-intent-display
key.summary: The rendering intent to use for the display, e.g. 'perceptual'
key.description: The rendering intent to use for the display, e.g. 'perceptual'.

key.name: rendering-intent-softproof
key.summary: The rendering intent to use for softproofs, e.g. 'perceptual'
key.description: The rendering intent to use for softproofs, e.g. 'perceptual'.

key.name: colorspace-rgb
key.description: The RGB profile filename to be used by applications by default.

key.name: colorspace-cmyk
key.description: The CMYK profile filename to be used by applications by default.

key.name: colorspace-gray
key.description: The gray profile filename to be used by applications by default.

key.name: calibration-length
key.description: The length of calibration, as this is proportional to the accuracy. The option 'short' creates a quick profile, 'normal' a regular one, and 'long' takes a really long time, but is more precise and creates a better profile. Use 'ask' if you want the user to choose.

key.name: recalibrate-display-threshold
key.summary: The duration between sending notifications to recalibrate a display
key.description: This is the number of seconds in between notifying the user to recalibrate each display device. Set to 0 to disable the notification.

key.name: recalibrate-printer-threshold
key.summary: The duration between sending notifications to recalibrate a printer
key.description: This is the number of seconds in between notifying the user to recalibrate each printer device. Set to 0 to disable the notification.

key.name: enable-sane
key.description: This allows the user to disable scanner support if attached devices fail when probed.

key.name: profile-graph-type
key.summary: The graph type to show in the properties page
key.description: The graph type in the properties page. This should not be changed manually as this is set from the UI.
